meanings.definition: Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).
meanings.sent1: The cat ran thru the door quickly.
meanings.sent2: The car drove thru the tunnel smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hopped thru the tree branches playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut thru the silence like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed thru the valley with a gentle murmur.

meanings.sent1: We traveled thru the forest to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent2: She sent the package thru the mail.
meanings.sent3: He found his way thru the maze of streets easily.
meanings.sent4: The music echoed thru the halls of the old building.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered thru the leaves, creating a dappled pattern on the ground.

meanings.sent1: Thru the night, the owl hooted in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The festival lasted thru the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The laughter echoed thru the party all evening.
meanings.sent4: Her smile shone thru the darkest of times.
meanings.sent5: The scent of flowers lingered thru the garden all day.
